intro: Robertsonia nivalis, commonly known as the snow Robertsonia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically broad and heart-shaped, with a distinctive blue-green hue. Robertsonia nivalis thrives in cool, high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
